The idea is maintain multiple free lists where free list is assigned for each different sized block. The OS will pick the list containing blocks at least as large as the request.
![](data:image/png;base64,)

Pros -> Fast allocation and free;
- There is no exhaustive search required, no coalescing or splitting
Cons -> Inefficient
- Memory divided into "regions" based on block size.
- Number and frequency of requests for a block size depends on the applications you are trying to run.
